title: Is tolerance on wane, asks Prez
text: Suri (west Bengal), Oct 19 President Pranab Mukherjee today expressed serious apprehensions over whether tolerance and acceptance of dissent were on the wane in the country. “Humanism and pluralism should not be abandoned. Assimilation through receiving is a characteristic of Indian society. Our collective strength must be harnessed to resist evil powers in society,” Mukherjee said. At a function, Mukherjee asked: “Whether tolerance and acceptance of dissent are on the wane? “The essential part of the Indian civilisation and culture is its pluralism. Our bond is strong because of tolerance — to accept the other’s religion and other’s opinion,” the President added. “Indian civilisation has survived for 5,000 years because of its tolerance. It has always accepted dissent and differences. A large number of languages, 1,600 dialects and seven religions coexist in India. We have a constitution that accommodates all these differences,” he said. — Agencies
